==Events==
* [[363]] &ndash; Emperor [[Julian (emperor)|Julian]] marches back up the [[Tigris]] and burns his fleet of supply ships. During the withdrawal Roman forces suffering several attacks from the [[Persia]]ns.
* [[632]] &ndash; [[Yazdegerd III]] ascends to the throne as king (''[[shah]]'') of the [[Sasanian Empire|Persian Empire]]. He becomes the last ruler of the [[Sasanian family tree|Sasanian dynasty]] (modern [[Iran]]).
*[[1407]] &ndash; [[Ming–Hồ War]]: Retired King [[Hồ Quý Ly]] and his son King [[Hồ Hán Thương]] of [[Hồ dynasty]] are captured by the [[Ming dynasty|Ming]] armies.
*[[1487]] &ndash; [[Battle of Stoke Field]], the final engagement of the [[Wars of the Roses]].
*[[1586]] &ndash; [[Mary, Queen of Scots]], recognizes [[Philip II of Spain]] as her [[Royal succession#Monarchies and nobility|heir and successor]].
*[[1745]] &ndash; British troops take [[Cape Breton Island]], which is now part of [[Nova Scotia]], Canada.
*  1745   &ndash; [[War of the Austrian Succession]]: [[New England]] colonial troops under the command of [[William Pepperrell]] capture the [[French colonial empires|French]] [[Fortress of Louisbourg]] in [[Louisbourg, Nova Scotia]] ([[Old Style]]).
*[[1746]] &ndash; War of Austrian Succession: Austria and [[Sardinia]] defeat a Franco-Spanish army at the [[Battle of Piacenza]].
*[[1755]] &ndash; [[French and Indian War]]: the [[Military history of France|French]] surrender [[Fort Beauséjour]] to the British, leading to the expulsion of the [[Acadians]].
*[[1774]] &ndash; Foundation of [[Harrodsburg, Kentucky]].
*[[1779]] &ndash; Spain declares war on the Kingdom of Great Britain, and the [[Great Siege of Gibraltar]] begins.
*[[1795]] &ndash; [[First Battle of Groix]] otherwise known as "Cornwallis' Retreat".
*[[1815]] &ndash; [[Battle of Ligny]] and [[Battle of Quatre Bras]], two days before the [[Battle of Waterloo]].
*[[1816]] &ndash; [[Lord Byron]] reads ''[[Fantasmagoriana]]'' to his four house guests at the [[Villa Diodati]], [[Percy Shelley]], [[Mary Shelley]], [[Claire Clairmont]], and [[John Polidori]], and inspires his challenge that each guest write a ghost story, which culminated in Mary Shelley writing the novel ''[[Frankenstein]]'', John Polidori writing the short story ''[[The Vampyre]]'', and Byron writing the poem ''[[Darkness (poem)|Darkness]]''.
*[[1836]] &ndash; The formation of the [[London Working Men's Association]] gives rise to the [[Chartism|Chartist Movement]].
*[[1846]] &ndash; The [[Papal conclave, 1846|Papal conclave of 1846]] concludes. [[Pope Pius IX]] is elected [[Pope]] beginning the longest reign in the history of the papacy.
*[[1858]] &ndash; [[Abraham Lincoln]] delivers his ''[[Lincoln's House Divided Speech|House Divided]]'' speech in [[Springfield, Illinois]].
*  1858   &ndash; The Battle of Morar takes place during the [[Indian Mutiny]].
*[[1871]] &ndash; The [[Test Act|University Tests Act]] allows students to enter the Universities of [[University of Oxford|Oxford]], [[University of Cambridge|Cambridge]] and [[University of Durham|Durham]] without religious tests (except for those intending to study [[theology]]).
*[[1883]] &ndash; The [[Victoria Hall disaster|Victoria Hall theatre panic]] in [[Sunderland, Tyne and Wear|Sunderland]], England kills 183 children.
*[[1884]] &ndash; The first purpose-built roller coaster, [[LaMarcus Adna Thompson|LaMarcus Adna Thompson's]] "[[Switchback Railway]]", opens in New York's [[Coney Island]] amusement park.
*[[1891]] &ndash; [[John Abbott]] becomes Canada's third [[Prime Minister of Canada|Prime Minister]].
*[[1897]] &ndash; A treaty annexing the [[Republic of Hawaii]] to the United States is signed; the Republic would not be dissolved until a year later.
*[[1903]] &ndash; The [[Ford Motor Company]] is incorporated.
*  1903   &ndash; [[Roald Amundsen]] commences the first east-west navigation of the [[Northwest Passage]], leaving [[Oslo]], Norway.
*[[1904]] &ndash; [[Eugen Schauman]] assassinates [[Nikolai Ivanovich Bobrikov|Nikolai Bobrikov]], [[Governor-General of Finland]].
*  1904   &ndash; Irish author [[James Joyce]] begins a relationship with [[Nora Barnacle]] and subsequently uses the date to set the actions for his novel ''[[Ulysses (novel)|Ulysses]]''; this date is now traditionally called "[[Bloomsday]]".
*[[1911]] &ndash; [[IBM]] founded as the Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company in [[Endicott, New York]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; A 772 gram stony [[meteorite]] strikes the earth near [[Kilbourn, Wisconsin]] damaging a barn.
*[[1915]] &ndash; Foundation of the [[British Women's Institute]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; General election in the [[Irish Free State]]: the pro-Treaty [[History of Sinn Féin|Sinn Féin]] win a large majority.
*[[1924]] &ndash; The [[Whampoa Military Academy]] is founded.
*[[1925]] &ndash; The most famous [[Young Pioneer]] camp of the [[Soviet Union]], [[Artek (camp)|Artek]], is established.
*[[1930]] &ndash; [[Sovnarkom]] establishes [[decree time]] in the USSR.
*[[1933]] &ndash; The [[National Industrial Recovery Act]] is passed.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Marshal [[Henri Philippe Pétain]] becomes Chief of State of [[Vichy France]] (''Chef de l'État Français'').
*  1940   &ndash; A [[Communist]] government is installed in [[Lithuania]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; At age 14, [[George Stinney|George Junius Stinney, Jr.]] becomes the youngest person executed in the United States in the 20th century.
*[[1948]] &ndash; Members of the [[Malayan Communist Party]] kill three British plantation managers in [[Sungai Siput]]; in response, [[British Malaya]] declares [[Malayan Emergency|a state of emergency]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; In a futile effort to topple [[President of Argentina|President]] [[Juan Perón]], rogue aircraft pilots of the [[Argentine Navy]] [[Bombing of Plaza de Mayo|drop several bombs]] upon an unarmed crowd demonstrating in favor of Perón in [[Buenos Aires]], killing 364 and injuring at least 800. At the same time on the ground, some forces soldiers attempt to stage a coup but are suppressed by loyal forces.
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[Imre Nagy]], [[Pál Maléter]] and other leaders of the 1956 [[Hungarian Revolution of 1956|Hungarian Uprising]] are executed.
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[Rudolf Nureyev]] defects from the Soviet Union.
*[[1963]] &ndash; Soviet Space Program: ''[[Vostok 6]]'' Mission &ndash; [[Cosmonaut]] [[Valentina Tereshkova]] becomes the first woman in space.
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[Monterey Pop Festival]] begins
*[[1972]] &ndash; The largest single-site hydroelectric power project in Canada is inaugurated at [[Churchill Falls Generating Station]].
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Soweto uprising]]: a non-violent march by 15,000 students in [[Soweto]], South Africa turns into days of rioting when police open fire on the crowd.
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[Oracle Corporation]] is incorporated in [[Redwood Shores, California]], as Software Development Laboratories (SDL) by [[Larry Ellison]], [[Bob Miner]] and [[Ed Oates]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; U.S. President [[Ronald Reagan]] awards the [[Congressional Gold Medal]] to [[Kenneth D. Taylor|Ken Taylor]], Canada's former ambassador to [[Iran]], for helping six Americans escape from Iran during the [[Iran hostage crisis|hostage crisis of 1979-81]]; he is the first foreign citizen bestowed the honor.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Revolutions of 1989]]: [[Imre Nagy]], the former Hungarian [[Prime Minister of Hungary|Prime Minister]], is reburied in [[Budapest]] following the collapse of Communism in Hungary.
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Israel]] complies with [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 425]] 22 years after its issuance, which calls on Israel to completely withdraw from [[Lebanon]]. Israel does so, except the disputed [[Shebaa farms]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[Bhutan]] becomes the first country to institute a [[Tobacco Control Act of Bhutan 2010|total ban on tobacco]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; China successfully launches its [[Shenzhou 9]] spacecraft, carrying three astronauts – including the first female Chinese astronaut, [[Liu Yang (astronaut)|Liu Yang]] – to the [[Tiangong-1]] orbital module.
*  2012   &ndash; The [[United States Air Force]]'s robotic [[Boeing X-37B]] [[spaceplane]] returns to Earth after a [[USA-226|classified 469-day orbital mission]].
